item.description:
Kayaking on the Charles

WHEN: Sunday, Sept. 18

Trip's Coordinator: Michael

EVENT:  Come join the fun and enjoy the outdoors with other Mosaic members as they paddle down the most scenic and uncrowded parts of the Charles River in kayaks, starting in Nahanton Park in Newton.  If you have limited experience, this is the trip for you. Relax over ice cream afterwards at J.P. Licks in Newton Center. Rain cancels.

MEET: At 1 p.m.  in Nahanton Park in Newton, 455 Nahanton St., (Kendrick Street), Newton, on the Newton/Needham town line. From the north or south on Route 128.

RSVP:  Participants should reply by Saturday, Sept. 17. Those who don’t RSVP can also participate as long as there is equipment available. The TC will try to hold a kayak for anyone who RSVP’s and will supply his cell phone number to participants to coordinate meeting at the site. Not sure you can kayak alone? Bring a friend or pair up and rent a double. Let the TC know if you want this option when you RSVP and he’ll do his best.  Contact the TC with questions.

COST: Single Kayak, $15; Double kayak, $18 plus $5 which will be credited to a full membership of $25 in Mosaic.

http://www.paddleboston.com/

Charles River Canoe & Kayak

2401 Commonwealth Ave.

Newton, Massachusetts 02466

617-965-5110
item.how_to_find_us: Contact the Trip's Coordinator, Mike or look for some people in the Park with Mosaic Caps by the kayak rentals

group.name: Mosaic Jewish Outdoor Club of Massachusetts

item.name: A Day of Kayaking
